titles.title: Prescription Drug Assistance Act of 2000
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow individuals who have attained age 65 a credit against income tax for certain drug and health insurance expenses.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 4/11/2000--Introduced. Prescription Drug Assistance Act of 2000 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to provide a tax credit of up to $500 for individuals age 65 and older for: (1) any drug prescribed for such individual or his or her spouse; and (2) coverage of such individual or spouse under either a Medicare (title XXVIII of the Social Security Act) supplemental policy providing coverage for prescription drugs or a Medicare+Choice plan providing such coverage.
